Databases

Table of contents

  1. Google Dataset Search
  2. Journal of Open Psychology Data
  3. OpenNeuro
  4. CRCNS
  5. Open Psychometrics
  6. Open Datasets in Electrophysiology

Google Dataset Search

Google Dataset Search is a search engine from Google that helps researchers locate online data that is freely available for use.

Journal of Open Psychology Data

The Journal of Open Psychology Data features peer reviewed data papers describing psychology datasets with high reuse potential.

OpenNeuro

OpenNeuro is a free and open platform for sharing behavioral, MRI, MEG, EEG, iEEG, and ECoG data.

CRCNS

The Collaborative Research in Computational Neuroscience group has a repository of publicly available, high quality datasets valuable for testing computational models of the brain and new analysis methods. The data include physiological recordings from sensory and memory systems, as well as eye movement data.

Open Psychometrics

Open Psychometrics contains vast amounts of publicly available data from personality tests.

Open Datasets in Electrophysiology

A list of openly available electrophysiological data, including EEG, MEG, ECoG/iEEG, and LFP data, maintained by the Voytek lab.
